test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string1args-1
test-case.description: Test codepoints-to-string with variety of characters

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string1args-2
test-case.description: Test codepoints-to-string with an empty sequence argument

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string1args-3
test-case.description: Test invalid type in argument for codepoints-to-string

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string1args-4
test-case.description: Test incorrect arity for codepoints-to-string

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-1
test-case.description: Invalid XML character codepoint as part of "code-points-to-string" function.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-2
test-case.description: Invalid XML character codepoint as part of "code-points-to-string" function.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" with argument set to codepoint 49 (single character ('1')).

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn-codepoints-to-string" with argument set to codepoint 97 (a single character 'a').

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" with argument set to codepoints 49, 97 (combination of number/character '1a').

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" with argument set to the codepoints 35, 42, 94 36 (characters "#*^$").

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" with argument set to codepoints 99 111 100 101 112 111 105 110 116 115 45 116 111 45 115 116 114 105 110 103 (string "codepoints-to-string").

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" used as argument to "xs:string()" function and uses codepoints 65, 32, 83 116, 114, 105, 110, 103 ("A String") .

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" used as argument to the "fn:upper-case" function and use codepoints 65,32,83,84,82,73,78,71 (string "A STRING").

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" used as argument to the "fn:lower-case" function and use codepoints 97,32,115,116,114,105,110,103 (String "a string").

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that uses xs:integer as argument and codepoints 97.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that uses fn:avg/xs:integer function and codepoints 65,32,83,116,114,105,110,103.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that is used as argument to fn:concat function.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that is used as argument to fn:string-to-codepoints function.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that is used as argument to fn:string-length function.

test-case.name: fn-codepoints-to-string-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoints-to-string" that is used as argument to fn:string-join function.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string()`.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string((84, 104), "INVALID")`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(()) eq ""`.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string((87, 36, 56, 87, 102, 96)) eq "W$8Wf`"`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(57343)`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(-500)`.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(0)`.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-8
test-case.description: Codepoint 8 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-8a
test-case.description: Codepoint 8 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1. Test created according to bug issue 29405

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(9) eq "	"`.

test-case.description:
A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(10) eq "
"`.

test-case.description: Codepoint 11 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1.

test-case.description: Codepoint 11 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1.

test-case.description: Codepoint 12 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1.

test-case.description: Codepoint 12 is invalid in XML 1.0 but valid in XML 1.1.

test-case.name: K-CodepointToStringFunc-13
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `codepoints-to-string(13) eq ""`.

modified.change: wrapped test in a CDATA Section to prevent changing query by XML CRLF handling
Add dependency on XQuery because of use of XML character reference

test-case.description: fn:codepoints-to-string on multibyte ranges

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-016
test-case.description: fn:codepoints-to-string on multibyte ranges

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-017
test-case.description: Test codepoints to string on a range, returning a boolean
test-case.test: for $x in 32 to 64 return boolean(codepoints-to-string($x to $x + 10))

result.assert-string-value: true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true true

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-018
test-case.description: Tries to force evaluate to item on codepoint-to-string
test-case.test: if(5 < exactly-one((1 to 10)[. div 2 = 5])) then codepoints-to-string(32 to exactly-one((1 to 100)[. div 2 = 40])) else ()

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-019
test-case.description: Tests for calling EvaluateToOptionalItem
test-case.test: for $x in 65 to 75 return string-length(codepoints-to-string($x to $x+10))

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-020
test-case.description: Tests false returns from TryArguments
test-case.test: for $x in 65 to 75 return boolean(codepoints-to-string($x[. mod 2 = 0] to ($x+9)[. mod 2 = 0]))

result.assert-string-value: false false false false false false false false false false false

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-021
test-case.description: Tests overflows
test-case.test: let $y := 65536*65536 return for $x in $y to $y+10 return codepoints-to-string(65 to $x)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-022
test-case.description: Tests overflows
test-case.test: let $y := 65536*65536 return for $x in $y to $y+10 return codepoints-to-string($x to $x+10)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-023
test-case.description: Tests invalid codepoint 0xB
test-case.test: for $x in 9 to 15 return codepoints-to-string($x to $x)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-024
test-case.description: Tests invalid codepoint 0xE
test-case.test: for $x in 13 to 15 return codepoints-to-string($x to $x)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-025
test-case.description: Tests valid codepoints 0x9, 0xA
test-case.test: for $x in 9 to 9 return codepoints-to-string($x to $x+1)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-026
test-case.description: Tests valid codepoint 0xD
test-case.test: for $x in 13 to 13 return codepoints-to-string($x to $x)

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoints-to-string-027
test-case.description: Tests last lower codepoint case
test-case.test: for $x in (13), $y in (13,9,10) return codepoints-to-string($x to $y)
